intro: Viguiera emaciata, commonly known as the slender ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils, preferring full sun. Its showy purple to pink flower heads bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Viguiera emaciata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits in native landscapes.
